metadata.name: Infinite Loops #18
metadata.description:
Infinite Loops are loops that animate‚Ä¶ infinitely! 

Actually you‚Äôll get 9-64 unique shapes that animate for 10, 20 or 30 seconds but loop seamlessly, at the default speed or extra fast, and a few other properties which altogether determine how peaceful or chaotic your loops experience will be.

It has 2 views, the default ‚Äòtunnel‚Äô view you see in the preview, and a grid view that displays all the shapes at once, and 20ish colour palettes, the rarity of which is defined by its name‚Äôs first letter, as a simple indicator.

Infinite Loops is designed to be viewed in motion and so also has some display/performance options. The default aspect ratio is 1:1 and size 1920x1920, but you can change to 9:16 or 16:9 at 1080p, you can also decrease the fps from 60 to 30, and/or reduce the resolution by half if you need a performance boost. 

The full list of controls as follows:

- [i] toggle the information/settings screen
- [p] pause the animation (which displays the completed curves)
- [d] downloads a png of the current state, with the completed curves
- [<] [>] switches between the tunnel & grid views
- [1] [2] [3] switches the aspect ratios (1:1, 9:16, 16:9)
- [f] toggle the frame rate
- [s] toggle the canvas size

For my first fx(hash) project it felt fitting to release Infinite Loops, a modest tribute to simple algorithms, colours and shapes, and the diversity of creations they produce together.

Created in p5js
NFT 2.0 License

metadata.name: Snell's Artifacts #91
metadata.description:
Snell's artifacts are imaginary geometric objects created using Snell's and Descartes' laws of optics that define the behavior of a ray of light passing from one transparent medium to another.

By applying these laws to extreme parameters, beyond what the real world is capable of producing and with a high level of variability, we open the door to a new world.

In order to keep some control over this extreme and crazy world, the grid within which the rays evolve is divided into several squares. Each of these squares limits the grid settings at that location.

In order to be able to generate a Snell Artifact, 1 to 6 million rays are created. It may take a while. So be patient while these radii are calculated.




Keyboard commands:
[S]: Saves a PNG image of 4000x4000 pixels without glow filter
[SHIFT + S]: Saves a 4000x4000 pixel PNG image and applies a glow filter (may take a long time depending on your system)

URL parameters:
Add the parameter size=N to generate an image of NxN pixels (glow effect will be disabled by default)
Add the parameter glow=true to apply a glow effect to the image




Artist: Estienne
July 2022

metadata.name: Ode to Random #22
metadata.description:
This simple minimalist generative token is a tribute to randomness. The underlying grid, the start and end of the colored shapes, the color styles, the transitioning point from order to chaos, are randomized. The names behind the Styles of this token are derived from artists who have greatly inspired me, all or most of whom have incorporated randomness or chaos in their art in one way or another.

The price and number of editions were also chosen using a pseudorandom number generator.

Embrace the random!

Made in p5js
Created December 2021
Artist: @Yazid

metadata.name: A Bugged Forest #876
metadata.description:
A forest has stories to tell.
About times that were, about times that will be.
-
This project was minted in much unusual conditions. 
We gathered here, by 38 degrees heat. We belong to a crowd who loves stories, of civilisations at stake and deities, of afterlife and worship. We drank and hugged and chanted pagan hymns. We minted the Bugged Forest from our place on earth that we call Hell just for the fun of it. We are passionate, and loving, and angry and desperate. We, people of the soil, under a bugged sun.
-
This project is the long-form version of an algorithm that contains a bug. ‚ÄúThe Bugged Tree‚Äù‚Äôs code was salvaged and stored and served as the core motivation and engine for an entire forest. Its concept is about releasing the control. I am a  byproduct of evolution, an iteration of that specie who wanted utter control, and which at some point, lost control over its own creation. As a generative artist, I chose to welcome the event of chance into my creative process. The symbolism in chance made me feel humble and free. Unwilling to make any change to a story that the Tree needed to tell me, as a listener, rather than a writer of my own idealised fantasies.
-
The iterations aren‚Äôt under control. They may be odd and off. We have to accept it. They are also plottable, press [s] in live mode to get a SVG. Attempt the plot at your own risk, as there‚Äôs a possibility for it to come near to impossibilities or cause paper or motor damage, and most certainly, a bugged drawing.
-
From Earth or from Hell, with love, yours truthfully, NFTBiker and zancan

metadata.name: GuilCity #206
metadata.description:
GuilCity is the beginning of an exciting journey bringing Guillaume Cornet‚Äôs densely-packed cities into the generative realm with the help of Matthew‚Äôs (@frostbitten‚Äôs) magic touch.

Matthew‚Äîwith his background in coding and animation‚Äîenables a new opportunity to experience these cities like never before. Numerous elements from vehicles to characters and even architecture have been given life. Interact with the city (computer mouse only): poke and peek around (even behind) in this active search & find journey! 

Each generative city fills the composition with the type of whimsical, expressive elements and characters you‚Äôve come to know Guil for. What kinds of wacky features have you discovered yet?

‚Äî

The tech behind this project utilizes the highly compressed WEBP image format in order to provide so many full-color options. This format is great, but unfortunately Safari on desktop/laptop must be upgraded to at least version 14 and macOS to at least version 11 Big Sur to use it.

The animation system for this project was created from scratch with additional help from the PIXI.js library for individual mesh animations.

‚Äî

To find out more about your GuilCity, copy your unique operation hash and place it at the end of the following url:
‚Ä¢ https://my.guil.city?fxhash=
(for example: https://my.guil.city?fxhash=ooezL8cffNJGSc4TfNQp3u3WnDpkg8J3zFRczLuumceoYU5QYPs)

‚Äî


The entire process has been a learning experience for both of us, adapting and exploring the many possibilities to interact with each others‚Äô skills and ideas.

We really enjoyed building this project together and are excited as we invite you to take a dive into your very own urban playground!

Merci √† tous! Cheers!
  - Guillaume Cornet, Matthew Seremet

metadata.name: Turner Light #291
metadata.description:
'Light is therefore colour' - J.M.W Turner

The shadows of the future are the light I emit now, and
I can only keep moving forward towards the core of the planet.
